priorVersion.title: CDISC SEND Challenge Agent Parameter Long Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C158117

self.title: CDISC SEND Challenge Agent Parameter Long Name Terminology

definition: Terminology related to the parameter names of the challenge agent characteristics within a study.
name: Challenge Agent Parameter Long Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Challenge Agent Parameter Long Name Terminology

terms.definition: The name of the direct supplier of the master bank or seed stock of organisms from which the biological challenge agent came.
terms.preferredTerm: Master Bank or Seed Stock Immediate Supplier
terms.submissionValue: Bio Ag Master Bank/Seed Stock Dir Supp
synonyms: Bio Master Bank or Seed Stock Dir Supp
Bio Master Bank or Seed Stock Direct Supplier

terms.definition: An indication as to whether the primary molecular and biological characteristics of the working bank or primary stock were confirmed.
terms.preferredTerm: Working Bank or Primary Stock Characterized Indicator
terms.submissionValue: Bio Ag Work Bank/Primary Stock Char Ind
synonyms: Bio Ag Work Bank/Primary Stock Char Ind
Biological Working Bank or Primary Stock Characterized Indicator

terms.definition: Identifying biovar name of the biological challenge agent.
A general classification of the biological challenge agent used in the study.
An indication as to whether a certificate of analysis exists for the biological challenge agent.
terms.preferredTerm: Biological Agent Certificate of Analysis Indicator
synonyms: Biological Agent Certificate of Analysis Indicator

terms.definition: An indication as to whether the biological challenge agent is engineered rather than naturally occurring.
The genus and species of the biological challenge agent used in the study.

The unique identifier code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of biological challenge agent. This may include batch number, lot number, spore lot number, batch/lot number, etc.
An indication as to whether the genetic sequence of the biological challenge agent has been determined.
The reference, citation, or database location of the nucleotide sequence for the biological challenge agent.
Identifying serovar name of the biological challenge agent.
Identifying strain name of the biological challenge agent.

A description of the area or extent of the body that is exposed to radiation, which may include information about the body part that is irradiated and procedures that may be done in conjunction with the radiation.
A general classification of the challenge agent used in the study.
The geographic location of the person, company, organization, or institution that supplied the challenge agent used in the study.
The name of the person, company, organization, or institution that supplied the challenge agent used in the study.
An indication as to whether a metabolite of the chemical challenge agent is known to cause or contribute to the injury or condition of interest.
terms.preferredTerm: Challenge Agent Metabolite Caused Injury Indicator
terms.submissionValue: Chemical Ag Metabolite Causes Injury Ind
synonyms: Chemical Ag Metabolite Causes Injury Ind
Chemical Agent Metabolite Causes Injury Indicator

terms.definition: The unique numerical identifier assigned by the Chemical Abstract Service (CAS), a division of the American Chemical Society, to the chemical challenge agent used in the study.
An indication as to whether a certificate of analysis exists for the chemical challenge agent.
terms.preferredTerm: Chemical Agent Certificate of Analysis Indicator

terms.definition: The unique identifier code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of chemical challenge agent. This may include batch number, lot number, batch/lot number, etc.
The name of the chemical challenge agent used in the study.
An indication as to whether the radiation injury is combined with infectious, physical, thermal, and/or chemical trauma.
The relative timing of the expected onset of the targeted injury, with respect to radiation exposure.
terms.preferredTerm: Expected Onset of Rad/Nuc Targeted Injury
terms.submissionValue: Exp Onset of Rad/Nuc Targeted Injury
synonyms: Exp Onset of Rad/Nuc Targeted Injury
Expected Onset of Rad/Nuc Targeted Injury

terms.definition: A description of the irradiation field as it pertains to orientation to the body and, when appropriate, the sequencing of exposure(s).
An indication as to whether the animal was challenged with agents from more than one challenge agent category.
terms.preferredTerm: Multiple Challenge Agent Different Category Indicator

terms.definition: An indication as to whether the animal was challenged with more than one agent from a single challenge agent category.
terms.preferredTerm: Multiple Challenge Agent Same Category Indicator
terms.submissionValue: Multiple Challenge Agent Same Cat Ind
synonyms: Multiple Challenge Agent Same Cat Ind
Multiple Challenge Agent Same Category Indicator

terms.definition: The proportion of bone marrow that is not irradiated, i.e., shielded or removed from field.
The form of ionizing radiation that is emitted by the rad/nuc agent source.
The energy of the irradiation beam produced by the source.
terms.preferredTerm: Radiological/Nuclear Agent Irradiation Source Beam Strength
terms.submissionValue: Rad/Nuc Agent Irrad Source Beam Strength
synonyms: Rad/Nuc Agent Irrad Source Beam Strength
Rad/Nuc Agent Irradiation Source Beam Strength

terms.definition: An indication as to whether there is more than one type of ionizing radiation associated with the rad/nuc challenge.
terms.preferredTerm: Challenge Agent Type Mixed Field Indicator

terms.definition: The literal identifier of the radioisotope, specified as the symbol of the chemical element followed by the mass number.
The mode by which the radiological or nuclear challenge agent is delivered to the subject.
The type of radiation injury that is being induced in the animal.
